meanings.definition: The outside limit of an object, area, or surface.
meanings.sent1: The edges of the table were sharp.
meanings.sent2: She ran her fingers along the edges of the book.
meanings.sent3: The cat walked along the edges of the room, pretending to be a tightrope walker.
meanings.sent4: The edges of the cliff seemed to whisper to the wind.
meanings.sent5: The edges of the puzzle piece fit perfectly together.

meanings.definition: The line along which two surfaces of a solid meet.
meanings.sent1: The edges of the box were taped shut.
meanings.sent2: He carefully aligned the edges of the paper before gluing them together.
meanings.sent3: The edges of the sandwich hugged the filling tightly.
meanings.sent4: The edges of the building cast long shadows in the afternoon sun.
meanings.sent5: The edges of the jigsaw puzzle connected seamlessly.

meanings.definition: The brink or verge of something.
meanings.sent1: She stood at the edges of the crowd, hesitant to join.
meanings.sent2: The car teetered on the edges of the cliff.
meanings.sent3: The edges of the ice cream cone threatened to drip on her hand.
meanings.sent4: The edges of the forest beckoned him to explore further.
meanings.sent5: The edges of the decision seemed blurry and uncertain.

meanings.definition: The sharpness or keenness of a blade or cutting instrument.
meanings.sent1: The chef tested the edges of the knife before slicing the vegetables.
meanings.sent2: The edges of the scissors were too dull to cut through the thick paper.
meanings.sent3: The edges of the sword gleamed in the sunlight, ready for battle.
meanings.sent4: The edges of the axe bit deeply into the wood.
meanings.sent5: The edges of the razor blade glinted dangerously under the light.
